Need to block antis or certain blogs check: *antis to block, #blogs to block, #blogs to report. Also tags you may need to blacklist if needed: #anti bs, #nsfw, #fandom wank.

tags: building a little more of this headcanon
i honestly have no idea what would happen once they do travel back tho
summary: @hello-shellhead said “Kinda really interested where this would go actually :)” Okay, I have honestly no clue what would happen...
body:
@hello-shellhead said “Kinda really interested where this would go actually :)”

Okay, I have honestly no clue what would happen plot-wise, but I love the idea of the kind of rapport that Tony and Wanda would build up (which isn’t a relationship I’ve seen explored a lot, but I think it could be very interesting). So I’m picturing something along these lines:

“We’re going to win this fight. Together.”

Those are Steve’s last words to Wanda. They’re his last lie to Wanda. And no matter how many funerals she attends, no matter how often her gaze lingers on endless lists of the names of the dead and the disappeared, Wanda can never quite convince herself to forgive him this one.

(It feels too much like letting go, one last time.)

In the end, there is no together.

There is only Wanda and the burned-out husk of a man she could have loved, maybe, in another life, surrounded by ashes and carnage and cursed silence. There is Stark, bloodied and broken, half-dead by the time his wrecked ship finally reaches Earth.

(There is also Clint– but. The less said about him, the better.)

Somehow when everyone else leaves – returns home to grieve in peace and privacy – Stark doesn’t. Or rather Wanda follows him home because there’s nowhere else she has to be and then she simply doesn’t leave.

Stark doesn’t ask her to.

(He used to be afraid of her once. Wanda can’t remember when she stopped seeing fear in his eyes. She can’t remember when she stopped hating him.)

There’s no forgiveness. No apologies. Too many scars, too many still smarting wounds lie beneath the oddly peaceful equilibrium they’ve found for themselves. But. Time heals all wounds or so they say. And for all that Wanda doubts the truth of the saying, she can’t deny that many things do indeed lose the flesh-cutting edge eventually.

It’s not about forgiving in the end. At least Wanda doesn’t think so. At some point she’s simply stopped needing to forgive Stark. At some point, she’s stopped demanding reparations.

These days, they are familiar. Are the closest thing to family either of them have left at this point. And whatever else they are to each other (whatever they used to be) matters less with every passing week.

And so, when the time comes for their final act, the secret solution they’ve been working so frantically, desperately towards, Wanda doesn’t think to call Clint, call anyone.

She shoots a simple, “See you on the other side,” at the man by her side and steps through the portal. 

(She doesn’t doubt for even a second that Stark will be right behind her.)

summary: I’m writing a little Stony-something on Word and I accidentally searched synonyms of “Tony” instead of another word. It seems...
body:
I’m writing a little Stony-something on Word and I accidentally searched synonyms of “Tony” instead of another word. It seems Word considers Tony as an Elegant, Posh (another way to say Elegant, as I’ve learned), Expensive, Stylish, Fashionable and Well-heeled baby man, and it’s actually not wrong, at all. Good job, Word.

For those who are wondering what synonyms I got for “Steve”, sadly I didn’t get anything :( But you know what? I’m pretty satisfied with Tony’s.

P.s. My version of Word is in Italian, the menu I circled simply says “synonyms”

blog.name: drabblesinthemoonlight
blog.title: Dancing In The Moonlight
blog.description: Out of order Winteriron and Ironwidow drabbles. An amateur female!Toni enthusiast and writer.

title: Chapter 10 Sneak peek
body:
For a split second, Stane stares at Toni with a frozen grin. 

For a split second, Toni feels an inkling of genuine fear. 

For a split moment. 

It passes quickly.  

“Mr.Stane,” Toni greets caustically, “we need a little information.”

summary:
Morgan: Daddy! Peter and Harley taught me a song to sing to you!!
Tony: Oh, that's wonderful! Sing it for me!
Morgan: *looks at...
body:
Morgan: Daddy! Peter and Harley taught me a song to sing to you!!

Tony: Oh, that’s wonderful! Sing it for me!

Morgan: *looks at Peter and Harley*

Peter and Harley: *give thumbs ups*

Morgan: Tale as old as time-

Tony: Oh, your singing Beauty and the Beas-

Morgan: Meme as old as Vine!!

Tony: Oh god no.

Morgan: Beauty and the *takes empty watter bottle and throws it* YEET!!!

Tony, chasing after Peter and Harley: WHAT HAVE YOU DONE TO MY ANGEL DAUGHTER?!?!

blog.name: rose-on-the-mountain
blog.title: Proof that Tony Stark has a Heart
blog.description: Avengers fiction, Ironman geeking and shipping Tony with all the Tech. Also writing AI internal dialogue using pseudocode.

body:
Desk

Tony drummed his fingers on the wood and waited.

This was not a pleasant experience. At all. But he didn’t have the focus to do something distracting, and if he opened a work document right now, he’d make enough of a mess that Pepper would have double time fixing it.

So he waited.

And tapped the desk.

The phone didn’t ring and didn’t ring, sitting on its damn cradle like a neolithic relic and doing fuck all.

He switched from tapping the desk to spinning his phone between palm and thigh, daring the desk phone to ring, and having the absurd thought that maybe if he made it jelous of his smartphone it might get it’s shit together.

No such luck, of course. Fucking inanimate objects. No sense of proper pride.

He threw his smartphone to the blotter and stood up, his chair skittering away from the force of it.

Outside the window, upstate New York heaved with sweaty summer heat, trees dulled with it and grass yellowing beneath the bifrost sigil. He tapped irritably on the glass, urging news to come faster, until his fingers ached and the click clicking of his fingernails was too fucking irritating to stand.

God damnit, didn’t they have any idea how–

The phone rang.

Tony scrambled back to the desk, and almost knocked the reciever off the top in his frantic grab for the phone.

“Tony?”

“Sam.”

“He’s out of surgery, Tony. He’s gonna be okay.”

The rest of the message was lost in the ringing in his ears and the clatter of the handset against the desk.

Tony found himself staring up at the underside of it, room spinning and head too light to be connected to his body.

Oh thank god.

reblog.comment:
Desk

Tony drummed his fingers on the wood and waited.

This was not a pleasant experience. At all. But he didn’t have the focus to do something distracting, and if he opened a work document right now, he’d make enough of a mess that Pepper would have double time fixing it.

So he waited.

And tapped the desk.

The phone didn’t ring and didn’t ring, sitting on its damn cradle like a neolithic relic and doing fuck all.

He switched from tapping the desk to spinning his phone between palm and thigh, daring the desk phone to ring, and having the absurd thought that maybe if he made it jelous of his smartphone it might get it’s shit together.

summary: alright y’all don’t hate me but how heartbreaking and awesome would it be if my morgan stark ended up as a villain? and like...
body: alright y’all don’t hate me but how heartbreaking and awesome would it be if my morgan stark ended up as a villain? and like that’s why the chose they name. it hurts me so much but i’m also obsessed with the idea??? morgan stark being a badass villain? yes please. and like she could hate spider-man because as much as we love him her dad lowkey died with him in mind and idk but it could be cool

tags: i did a fanart for my own fic
read it man you wont regret it
summary: Tony’s lab attire from @whumphoarder and my collab story, Super Duper Side Effects! Fic summary as follows: The downside of an...
caption:
Tony’s lab attire from @whumphoarder and my collab story, Super Duper Side Effects!

Fic summary as follows:

The downside of an enhanced metabolism is that it renders most drugs completely ineffective. Captain America accepted this long ago as an occupational hazard. But after Peter sustains a serious injury in the line of duty and the doctors have no way to manage the pain, Steve decides to volunteer as a test subject for Bruce and Tony’s experimental super drug.

However, the soldier ends up getting a little more than he bargained for.

(Also featuring a little easter egg from our other masterpiece)
